newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Life to boost capital base by 150 bln yen.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Life to boost capital base by 150 bln yen.

text.p: Japan's Nippon Life Insurance Co announced on Monday that it would boost its capital base by 150 billion yen to 300 billion yen, partly to protect its policyholders from various risks.
The nation's biggest life insurer, which is in the form of a mutual company, as are other Japanese life insurers, will raise its foundation funds, which are the equivalent to capital.
It will raise the funds by borrowing money from companies and financial institutions for a five-year period at fixed interest rates, Nippon Life said in a statement.

Nippon Life also said that unrealised profit on its stock holdings, which totalled 3.08 trillion yen as of the end of March 1997, would be wiped out if the benchmark Nikkei 225 share average dropped sharply to the 12,000 level.
The average ended the Monday session 261.93 points, or 1.28 percent, lower at 20,223.82.
